Nutrition is about eating the right foods to stay healthy and grow. This includes six key nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. Eating a balanced diet helps you stay strong, fight off sickness, and avoid long-term health problems. Not getting enough of these nutrients can make you sick or not grow well. Learning about nutrition helps you choose healthy foods and live a healthy life.

Write a summary about 'nutrition'. Limit the output to 100 words. 'Nutrition' refers to the intake and utilization of nutrients to maintain health and support growth. It involves consuming a balanced diet, comprising macro-nutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, fats), micro-nutrients (vitamins, minerals), and water. Adequate nutrition promotes physical growth, boosts immune function, enhances cognitive abilities, and reduces risk of chronic diseases. Proper nutrition is essential for all stages of life, with special attention required during infancy, childhood, and old age. Good nutrition starts with a variety of foods, including fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, whole grains, and dairy products. It's also important to stay hydrated and limit intake of processed, high-sugar, and high-fat foods. Regular physical activity complements good nutrition, ensuring overall health and well-being.
